even after 1.21 copper can still be used for so many cool features like this. i was hoping for copper bars or copper chains with the update aswell
They should as well add copper rails so it becomes easier to make.
I feel like item frames are enough. You can make them glow or even invisible
You can use banners. The non-standard multi-layered use of patterns allows you to create almost any pattern, and with a choice of colors.
Hanging item frames?
this would be cool to see. Opens up more structure designs.
hanging item frames could be cool
You could definitely have like a hanging item frame crafted with a hanging sign and item frame or something.

i love this idea! however, maybe depending on the wood you craft the bed with, you can get a bed with said wood? it would change the crafting mechanics so that you can no longer  craft a bed with multiple types of wood at once, but it would add a beautiful addon. Perhaps you could have, for exmaple, a pink bed as any type of wood you want! Your idea is amazing! :D

I am too invented it! LIKE!!!
Really good idea but i think the name of the achievement should be different
There are too much armour trims and I think that is impossible to collect them all in survival
Great idea! Should be called: "The trimmer" could potentially be a hidden achievement as well!
For one I am always up to new achievements being added, plus the name of the item can provide so many puns for the achievement name, I simply love this idea
This would be good.

Something I've always wanted if a palm tree was added, and I think would work equally well for a fern tree, is for the leaf blocks to be half-slabs. It makes sense for the long flat leaves and would offer a green half-slab which the game is still lacking.

Tree Fern Spores found only in grass and podzol.

These would grow on farmland into a sapling of sorts, a tree fern shoot.

Then can be either eventual or bone meal grown into my green wood, finally my green wood.

I notice that would be a third wood-set record-breaking for a single update though.

Great idea. Sniffer is very cool mob, it will be shame if it's only purpose in the game is give the player one new kind of decorative and otherwise useless plant. At least three or four and yes, fern trees is perfect variant.
Tree fern logs could have the unique property of smelting to coal instead of charcoal. Not exactly realistic, but still educational, since that's the kind of tree that fossilized to actual coal.
I like this but i think those should be a lot more drastic like the two other curses. Like, vulnerability should give little to no protection for the enchanted.

I like what the other guy said about vulnerability but I think it should be even more drastic possibly making it easier to be damaged or making the chest plate take more damage than normal while also providing little or no protection

I would add
1. Curse of secrecy - hides the durability of the item
2. Curse of binding - hidden until it gets into inventory
Cannot be dropped or transferred to a chest
When compatible with recovery compass and the compass prevents them from dropping after death 5 times
At the same time, recovery compass shows the coordinates of the place of death
A regular compass shows the coordinates
Coordinates are written on top of the hotbar when the item is in inventory
This would be a good replacement for coordinates if mojang removed f3 from survival
3. Curse of dressing - does not allow you to wear armor
4. A mob that can apply a curse with some chance
You can also make a curse that reduces the luck of a drop from a mob or block

Curses are supposed to add challenge to the game. Plus, you can already give cursed gear to certain mobs.

As a bonus, here's a curse idea.

Curse of Poison - (Armor enchantment) gives you poison for 3-5 seconds (depends on level) after you get hit.

A bit of a strange idea but hear me out, curse of conductivity, increases the chance you get hit by lightning while in a thunderstorm by x% for each piece of armor with this curse you have equipped, maybe something like 5% for each making it 20% maximum so it's not just a guaranteed lightning hit

Not sure about the unused mobs like the Giant or Illussioner (until they get added) but the variants obtainable in survival/creative without commands like Brown Mooshroom, Killer Rabbit, and Charged Creeper should definitely have their spawn eggs in the Creative Menu for ease of access. The less stuff behind commands the better so we don't have to memorize them unless we need to put them in command blocks.

I don't think this works, considering on 2b2t they are balanced to work best with high damage, short range, and normal 64 stack size. Properly understood, end crystals are directional explosives and not grenades. Also consider that much of crystal pvp is performed with precisely configured hacks that would be a pain to rework.

Since 1.7 was named ‚ÄúThe Update that changed the World‚Äù and it added multiple new biomes and a lot of features the community requested, I would call this the Update that Changed the World Again! Because again a lot of community requested ideas were implemented such as the cherry blossom biome, bamboo wood, hanging signs, the possibility of storing books in bookshelves, now called ‚Äúchiseled bookshelves‚Äù as per Mojang said, we also received a new mob and plant! Possibly more plants with more features in the future! Again, this is sort of a second part of what Mojang did in 1.7, so a continuation in the name would seem fitting!

Wow! I like this!

adding onto the entire archeology thing, add copper golems, and make them be in their oxidized form frozen in the hidden rooms found under suspicious sand. this would be a crazy amzing addition to the whole archeology spiel, and wound add my personal favorite mob vote 2021 loser out of all of them to the game in a subtle way that still works. finally, add an ancient tree type like and ancient dinosaur palm of which you can get through the sniffer. if we want to go that far, bring back the stone chests in the old deep dark ancient city concepts, and make a specific key that you can only get through archeology that is meant to open the stone chests. this will just add to the ancient feel of all of this archeological discovery added to the game. what im trying to get at, is that archeology could be a whole lot more than just digging in sand next to a booby trapped temple to find peaces for your next antique, and instead can be the exploration of the whole of the minecraft world before time had a name. if we could get this upgrade to the existing features in minecraft, then we could revolutionize they entire game and pull the players attention not to the features they dont have, but to the idea, that there used to be and entirely different ecosystem in times so old they can't even imagine going back that far. please add this mojang. we love our archeology, and we want it to fulfill the best of it potential.

It might be a little too overpowered if you could mix and match effects like fire resistance and night vision, it might have to be nerfed by the player having to use the same trim throughout the full armor set to receive the effect.
